current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish a voluntary national directory of
			 veterans to support outreach to veterans, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in coordination with the

, shall establish a
			 program to facilitate outreach to veterans by covered entities.

text.#text: The
For purposes of this section, a covered entity is any of the following:
The

The agency or department of a State that
			 is the primary agency or department of the State for the administration of
			 benefits and services for veterans in the State.
A political subdivision of a State.
An Indian tribe (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance
			 Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act/s:4

text.#text: To carry out the program required by paragraph (1), the

establish a national
			 directory of veterans as described in subsection (b); and
share information in the directory in accordance with subsection (c).

under

shall
			 ensure that the national directory includes a mechanism by which a

			 directory that pertains to the participating individual.

text.#text: The

shall establish a mechanism by which a

that the individual

shall establish a mechanism for the inclusion of

			 participating individuals but who had made an indication under paragraph
			 (3) and subsequently indicate that they would like to receive information
			 from participating entities under the program.

considers appropriate to

the privacy of individuals participating in the program;

the security of the information stored in the national directory.

considers appropriate.

text.#text: The

may share,
			 under the program established under subsection (a)(1), information in
			 the national directory concerning such individuals with entities
			 applicable to participating individuals.

text.#text:
Except as provided in paragraph (2), in order to connect participating individuals with information
			 about the
			 programs they could be eligible for or services, support, and information
			 they may be
			 interested in receiving, the

For purposes of this subsection, an entity that is applicable to a participating individual is a
			 covered entity from whom a participating individual has expressed
			 interest in receiving information under the program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 transmit such information to each entity applicable to the participating
			 individual.

text.#text: In a case in which a participating individual indicates to the
The name of a participating individual.
The e-mail address of a participating individual.
The postal address of a participating individual.
The phone number of a participating individual.

text.#text: Under the program, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not sell any information collected under this section.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not share any information collected under the program with any entity that is
			 not a participating entity.

text.#text: The

As a condition of participation in the program, a participating entity shall agree not to share any
			 information the participating entity receives under the program with any
			 third-party or
			 for-profit entities.

header.#text: Sharing with third-party and for-profit entities

text.#text:
As a condition of participation in the program, a participating entity shall agree not to include
			 in any information sent by the participating entity to a participating
			 individual a requirement that the participating individual or the family
			 of the participating individual purchase a product or service.

As a condition of participation in the program, a participating entity shall agree not to use any
			 information received under the program for any political communication.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a mechanism by which a participating entity may indicate to the

that the participating entity would no longer like to receive
			 information about participating individuals from the national directory.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that covered entities described in subsection (a)(2)(C) who are located
			 in the same region should work together in a manner such that only one of
			 them requests receipt of information under the program.

text.#text: It is the sense of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that covered entities described in subsection (a)(2)(C) should work
			 with third parties, such as veterans service organizations, military
			 community groups, and other entities with an interest in assisting
			 veterans, to develop the information the covered entities send to
			 participating individuals under the program.

text.#text: It is the sense of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop a plan to publicize the program and inform covered entities of the
			 benefits of participating in the program.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide a form for the collection of information to be
			 included in the national directory established under subsection (a).

text.#text: To each member of the Armed Forces separating from service in the Armed Forces, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, in consultation with the

, develop the
			 form provided under paragraph (1).

text.#text: The
Where the member intends to reside after separation.

How the individual can best be contacted, such as a telephone number, an e-mail address, or a
			 postal address.

For which types of benefits and services the member would like to receive communication and
			 outreach, such as health care, education, employment, and housing.

From which of the following the member would like to receive the communication and outreach
			 specified under clause (iii):
The

The agency or department of the State in which the member intends to reside after separation that
			 is the primary agency or department of the State for the administration of
			 benefits and services for veterans in the State.
A political subdivision of a State.

The form developed under subparagraph (A) shall allow a member of the Armed Forces who is in the
			 process of separating from service in the Armed Forces to indicate the
			 following:

Information provided to agencies and departments described in subparagraph (B)(iv)(III) will only
			 be provided as authorized and upon request by such agencies and
			 departments.

Political subdivisions of States that receive information under the
			 program established under subsection (a) may—

share such information with
			 such nonprofit organizations as the political subdivisions consider
			 appropriate; and

work with such organizations to provide the veterans with relevant information about benefits and
			 services offered by such organizations.

Information provided on the form developed under subparagraph (A) will never be sold, provided to a
			 for-profit entity, or used to send any sort of political communication.
The form developed under subparagraph (A) shall include notice of the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that the form provided under paragraph (1) is not primarily
			 electronic in nature.

that the

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

The report submitted under paragraph (1) shall include an examination and assessment of the
			 following:
The signup process and the effectiveness of the forms developed and provided under subsection (d).

to

text.#text: The effectiveness of efforts of the

The effectiveness of efforts of covered entities described in subsection (a)(2)(C) to protect the
			 personal information of participating individuals.

Whether additional limitations on the use of information collected under the program are necessary
			 to protect participating individuals from unwanted contact, or contact
			 that is inconsistent with the program.

Whether participating individuals are benefitting by participating in the program and whether
			 changing the program would improve such benefits.

The overall participation in the program, utilization of the program, and how such participation
			 and utilization could be improved.
Such other matters as the secretaries consider appropriate.
